verses.verse: "Be careful that you don't do your charitable works in the presence of people so to be seen by them.

"Therefore when you do your charitable works do not sound a trumpet before you like the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets in order that they may have the praise of people. Truly I say to you that they have their reward.
"But when you do charitable works, don't let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
so that your charitable works may be in secret and your Father who sees in secret will himself reward you openly.
"When you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and street corners, so that they may be seen by people. Truly I say to you that they have their reward.
"Instead when you pray, enter a private place, and after you have shut the door, then pray to your Father who sees in secret. Your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
"When you pray don't go on and on with the same empty phrases like the heathen use, for they think that they will be heard because they talk so much.
"Therefore don't be like them, for your Father knows what things you need even before you ask him.
"So then pray in this way: Â«Our Father who is in heaven, your name is very holy.
"Your kingdom come, your will be done on earth like it is in heaven.
"Give us today our necessary food.
"Forgive us our debt of sin, even as we forgive our debtors.
"Don't bring us into testing trials instead deliver us from evil. For yours is the kingdom, the power, and the glory forever. Amen'
"If you forgive people their wrongdoings, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
"But if you do not forgive people their wrongdoings, neither will your Father forgive you your wrongdoings.
"Furthermore when you fast, don't be like the hypocrites with a sad expression for they disfigure their faces so they can appear to men to fast. Truly I say to you that they have their reward.
"But you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,
so that you don't appear to fast to people but to your Father who is in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
" Do not store up treasures on earth for yourselves where moth and rust corrupts and where thieves break in and steal.
"Instead store up treasures for yourselves in heaven where neither moth or rust corrupts, and where thieves do not break in and steal.
"For where your treasure is, there is where your heart will be also.
"The light of the body is the eye, therefore if your eye is single, your whole body will be full of light.
"But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. Therefore if the light that is in you is darkness, how great is that darkness!
"No one can serve two masters, for he will either hate one and love the other or else he will cling closely to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.
"Therefore I say to you do not be troubled about your life, what you will eat, what you will drink, or about clothes for your body. Isn't life more than food and the body more than clothes?
"Look at the birds of the air, they don't sow, reap, or gather into barns, yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren't you much better than they?
"Which of you can add one cubit to your life by worrying?
"And why worry about clothes? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they don't work or spin cloth.
"Yet I say to you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.
"Therefore if God dresses the grass of the field which is today but tomorrow is thrown in the oven, won't he even more cloth you, O you of little faith?
"Therefore don't worry and say: what will we eat or what will we drink or what will we wear?
"For these are what the Gentiles seek, but your heavenly Father knows you need all these things.
"Instead first of all seek the Kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
"Therefore don't worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will have its own worries. The troubles of today are enough.
